m_szDocTitle: VBB-3 To Target 372 MPH Land Speed Record This Summer
m_szDocSumamry: VBB-3 To Target 372 MPH Land Speed Record This Summer 16 hours ago    by Mark Kane 0Comments Venturi Buckeye Bullet 3 (VBB-3) Venturi Buckeye Bullet 2.5 (2010: 307.66 mph / 495 km/h The most powerful “electric car” Venturi Buckeye Bullet 3 (VBB-3) with nearly 3,000 horsepower (2200 kW) will be back at the Bonneville Salt Flats this year with the goal of setting a new electric land speed record of some 400 mph (over 640 km/h). Previous version 2.5 set a record of  307.66 mph (495 km/h) in 2010. VBB-3 has so far been very unlucky with weather, which prevented higher speeds in 2013, 2014 and 2015
